adjective.description: (of an office or position) given as a mark of respect, but having few or no duties.
examples: an honorific award for military valor

noun.description: A title or word implying or expressing high status, politeness, or respect.
examples: he will be able to put the honorific after his name: licenciado, “college graduate.”

origin: Mid 17th century: from Latin honorificus, from honor honor.
